expected: <name>                    creates a new tag with given name; if the tag already exists, this command will fail
<start-point>             uses specified reference instead of HEAD
-h, --help                shows this help message and exits
-f, --force               forces creation of new tag even, if it already exists

-l, --list [<pattern>...] lists known tags; if any shell wildcard pattern is present, it only shows tags matching the pattern(s); when multiple patterns are given, if any of them matches, the tag is shown
-d, --delete <name>...    deletes existing tags with given names
